column5: And to be clear on details again - that was WalleyeCheek that carried it over to this thread.

Welcome to the thread (gaspumper)your absolutly right he can supply all the minnows being the largest bait dealer in the country.its to bad China let this virus spread over the world otherwise there would of been nothing but praise for clarks as there has been for years.Best outfitter in NWO.Best lakes to fish and top notch equipment and service. Cant take that away from them.
Like I said before........you make your posts, you takes your chances. I'll send you a brand new axe so you don't have to waste anymore time grinding the old one... Geezzz PjShorthorn

Some one might get the wrong impression of your thoughts on Clark's with this statement. To clarify here is a recent post of yours. 07-30-2020, 12:14 PM Da' Walleye Assassun I have been to Clark's. I have recommended Clark's on this forum. Do a search. Send them a voluntary donation. Involuntary donations are outright stealing.
dont mention free minnows around Net man......he gets bent outta shape !!!!!!!!
I hate to have to read all of your previous posts to try and gauge your character. And in the attempt to not be redundant I answered your question on the thread that you asked the question on.....
Maybe I better start a thread about free crawlers
I also get free crawlers........just go out at night after a nice rain get all the FREE crawlers you want !
Well, you made the post about free minnows . You makes your posts.....you takes your chances. By now you should have both sides of that axe ground down.....geeezzzz. PjShorthorn
Have done the crawler deal in the backyard.lol
I have no problem with some one responding to one of my post. But to be clear on this thread I did not make a post about free minnows.
Clark's should be able to supply free minners with all the money they stole...LOL
Yeah, I get it.....you called out ProV1800 on another thread regarding your thoughts about free minnows. It carried over to this thread too....just saying. PjShorthorn

I second Dabirdman's recommendation of Hidden Bay Lodge. We have fished with several outfitter in the past. But never had the service provided as Hidden Bay did. They dont treat you like a customer but welcome you like family. We discovered them with a google search. We had a truly sensational trip this year. We fished Armit lake. Only cabin on the lake. Maybe a 20 minute flight. The fish were fighting. Great facilities. We were well fed with their food included plan. Thank Wilma for the great pies. Get the strawberry rhubarb! Check them out. Shaggy, yes that is his name, helped us organize our trip. He was on top every question we had. You will not be disappointed.
You can't go wrong with one of the best outfitters in NW Ontario! Excellent fishing, great cabins and a top notch professional and courteous staff.http://www.walleye.ca

Not sure where you are coming from, but if you are crossing at I Falls, Northern Wilderness Outfitters flies out of Fort Francis, which is right there. They have a a few different outposts. We used them for about an hour flight to Glitter Lake and had a great experience.
Check out Northern Wilderness outfitters (online at http://northernwilderness.net/) Great guys, fair rates and just across from international falls.
I second Knobby's, first fly in, just returned 2 weeks ago. We stayed at Bamaji
Wilderness Air in Vermilion Bay has some great deals on right now. They also charge prices at par for Canadian guests.
There seems to be a lot of buzz about Clarkâ€™s, you might want to check them out.
Kabikwabik from Pickerel Arm Camps. 10 minute flight. Superb lake. Only cabin on lake
Yes, a lot of buzz on Clark's but do check out their website before you check out the buzz on other threads here at WC.
Winner! Winner! Clark's has free minners!

Looking for a fly in with walleye fishing. The one thing i'd like to focus on is a short flight on the float plane. Smaller lake, only cabin or only a few small cabins. Northwest ontario or more to the east. Thanks for any recommendations.
Check out Clarks resorts. You won't find a better operation in NW Ontario

Hidden Bay Lodge...fly their own plane (no charter), provide your meals, free night stay before flying out, free satellite phone, some outposts have free wifi. Super nice people, indoor bathrooms, etc. Flights are 24-45min I believe. Armit Lake, Gage Lake or Ragedwood Lake are smallest, easiest to navigate IMO.

Thunderhook out of Armstrong - Funger, MoonshineKabeelo Lodge out of Ear Falls - Okanse, Perrigo, WakemanIgnace Outposts out of Ignace - IreneHalley's Camps out of Minaki - MoosehornNestor Falls Fly-In Fishing out of Nestor Falls - KatimiagamakNorthwest Flying Inc out of Nestor Falls - AjaxHowey Bay Resort out of Red Lake - Little Vermillion, ValhallaAll 25 air miles or less from the air base.
https://www.walleyecentral.com/forum...ht=kearns+lake phish

Highly recommend Howey Bay flying out of Red Lake, ON. Dave McLeod and wife Marg run a great operation, super nice cabins (for a fly-in), everything works, no hassles. Went there for years! If you want more info, drop me a PM. Scott
Red Pine Lodge does fly ins. www.fishredpine.com
Check out https://www.wilderness-air-escapes.com
Knobby's in Sioux Lookout. https://canadianlodges.com/ontario-f...lodge-outposts

http://www.moosepointlodge.com/ for 20 years! Every so often my wife will throw back at me what she has over heard me tell buddies - "the best week of the year" We do the American plan lodge but years ago we used his outpost.
